steps.title: Use a hammer and chisel to cut flagstone when accuracy of cut or straight lines are not important.
steps.content: Use a hammer and chisel to cut flagstone when accuracy of cut or straight lines are not important. [1] X Research source A hammer and chisel is best to cut or shape flagstone for small projects that do not require accurate cuts, such as a small garden path or a decorative step or bench top. If you use a saw to cut every flagstone in the project, the cuts are going to look extremely clean, which might not be the desired result. If you don't need a too exact cut, you can use the chisel end of a masonry hammer to score the flagstone instead of using a chisel and a hammer.

steps.title: Set the flagstone on a solid surface.
steps.content: Set the flagstone on a solid surface.

steps.title: Measure and draw a line to cut.
steps.content: Measure and draw a line to cut.

steps.title: Leave a distinct bold line, such as that provided by paver chalk or a piece of roofer's slate.
steps.content: Leave a distinct bold line, such as that provided by paver chalk or a piece of roofer's slate. The measurement must allow for the space made by joint or mortar.

steps.title: Hammer sharply, but not heavily, on the chisel as you move it along the drawn line in order to score the line.
steps.content: Hammer sharply, but not heavily, on the chisel as you move it along the drawn line in order to score the line. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Continue to score along the line with even pressure.
steps.content: Continue to score along the line with even pressure. Allow time for this process, or you may crack or break the stone unintentionally.

steps.title: Continue to tap the chisel with the hammer along the scored line until stone breaks along the scored line.
steps.content: Continue to tap the chisel with the hammer along the scored line until stone breaks along the scored line. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Use a circular saw with masonry blade to make regular cuts in the same size for small projects, such as a fireplace hearth.
steps.content: Use a circular saw with masonry blade to make regular cuts in the same size for small projects, such as a fireplace hearth. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Clamp the flagstone firmly to a solid surface.
steps.content: Clamp the flagstone firmly to a solid surface.

steps.title: Measure and clearly draw the line to cut.
steps.content: Measure and clearly draw the line to cut.

steps.title: Begin to saw along the line.
steps.content: Begin to saw along the line.

steps.title: Do not apply pressure to the saw; just allow the weight of the saw to score the stone.
steps.content: Do not apply pressure to the saw; just allow the weight of the saw to score the stone. The intent is not to saw through the flagstone; rather, the purpose is to create a significant score in the stone along which repeated blows with a hammer and chisel will break the stone.

steps.title: Prop the stone that has been scored by the circular saw at an angle on a tool or brick along the bottom side of the flagstone parallel to the scored line.
steps.content: Prop the stone that has been scored by the circular saw at an angle on a tool or brick along the bottom side of the flagstone parallel to the scored line.

steps.title: Tap chisel with hammer sharply along the scored line until piece breaks away.
steps.content: Tap chisel with hammer sharply along the scored line until piece breaks away. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Cut flagstone with a wet saw if you have a large job or a job that requires accurate cuts or design cuts, such as a patio floor, a pool deck, curves or edging where you want to repeat a color scheme.
steps.content: Cut flagstone with a wet saw if you have a large job or a job that requires accurate cuts or design cuts, such as a patio floor, a pool deck, curves or edging where you want to repeat a color scheme. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Buy or rent a water-fed saw with a diamond edged blade.
steps.content: Buy or rent a water-fed saw with a diamond edged blade. Water is fed onto blade so it lubricates the cut and reduces the debris generated by the cut. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Read the assembly and usage directions carefully.
steps.content: Read the assembly and usage directions carefully.

steps.title: Measure and score the line desired.
steps.content: Measure and score the line desired.

steps.title: Move the stone steadily along the line against the saw blade because on a wet saw the blade does not move.
steps.content: Move the stone steadily along the line against the saw blade because on a wet saw the blade does not move.

steps.title: Push the stone flat, steadily, and slowly through the blade until the cut is complete.
steps.content: Push the stone flat, steadily, and slowly through the blade until the cut is complete.

steps.title: Clean and store tools.
steps.content: Clean and store tools.
